intro: Acioa hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy acioa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Acioa hirsuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
